title: The Papers: Law to stop small boats and Johnson 'to make dad a Sir'
description: Plans to end migrant Channel crossings and claims the ex-PM wants his father to be knighted lead the papers.

title: Egypt archaeology: Dig unearths smiling mini-sphinx which may represent Claudius
description: The artefact found in the Hathor Temple is thought to represent the Roman Emperor Claudius.

title: Brentford 3-2 Fulham: Bees' European dream gathers pace under inspirational boss Thomas Frank
description: A superbly run club, an inspirational manager and a talismanic forward, BBC Sport's chief football writer Phil McNulty assesses Brentford's European aspirations

title: Exposed for abuse but still revered – Japan’s J-pop predator
description: How did the high priest of Japanese pop, Johnny Kitagawa, exploit teenage boys with impunity for so long?

title: Chris Mason: Chance for progress on small boats - but can PM deliver?
description: Rishi Sunak has asked to be judged on tackling Channel crossings but there are no easy solutions.

title: Scottish Prison Service faces first UK prosecution for corporate homicide
description: Police are asked to examine whether Scotland's prison service has corporate responsibility over the death of Allan Marshall.

title: Bruno Fernandes should not captain Manchester United again - Chris Sutton
description: Chris Sutton believes Bruno Fernandes should not captain Manchester United again following Sunday's humiliating 7-0 defeat by Liverpool.

title: Brentford 3-2 Fulham: Ivan Toney scores as Bees boost European hopes with win
description: Brentford beat west London derby rivals Fulham at the Gtech Community Stadium to keep their hopes of European football very much alive.

title: Conor Benn: Boxer 'felt suicidal' during fall-out of positive drug tests
description: Boxer Conor Benn says he felt 'suicidal' in the aftermath of failing two drug tests last year.

title: Kemal Kilicdaroglu: Opposition picks 'Turkey's Gandhi' to challenge Erdogan in election
description: Quiet-spoken centre-leftist Kemal Kilicdaroglu is chosen by the opposition to run for president.

title: Spain $1.7m wine theft: Couple jailed for four years
description: A former Mexican beauty queen and her partner stole 45 bottles of wine from a luxury Spanish hotel.

title: Nitrous oxide: Laughing gas should not be banned, review says
description: Nitrous oxide, known as laughing gas, is the second most-used drug in the UK among 16 to 24-year-olds.

title: Cricket World Cup: Where are England seven months out from title defence, plus pick your team
description: With seven months until they defend their 50-over World Cup crown in India, we look at the questions England still need to answer.

title: Ukraine war: Bakhmut defenders double down - Zelensky
description: The president says the embattled eastern city's defence goes on, and that senior generals back the move.

title: Prince Harry praises mother Diana's legacy in fighting HIV
description: The Duke of Sussex recalls the work of Princess Diana in removing the stigma around HIV.

title: Twitter links and posting images down
description: It's the second time in a week that the platform has had significant problems.

title: Sir David Attenborough: Three must-see moments in new series
description: The nature presenter returns to TV screens to explore British natural history for the first time.

title: Bruno Fernandes: Man Utd captain did not ask to be substituted in Liverpool defeat
description: Manchester United captain Bruno Fernandes was not asking to be substituted towards the end of Sunday's 7-0 loss to Liverpool.

title: Firefighters will not strike after accepting new pay offer
description: Fire Brigades Union members vote to accept backdated 7% pay rise, with a further 5% increase in July.

title: Cardiff car crash: Tributes paid to three killed in crash
description: Tributes are paid to three people who were killed in a crash days after they went missing.

title: Liverpool 7-0 Manchester United: Micah Richards and Troy Deeney analysis
description: Match of the Day 2's Micah Richards and Troy Deeney explain what went wrong for Manchester United in their 7-0 thrashing at Liverpool.

title: Bangladesh v England: Tigers win by 50 runs to stop ODI series clean sweep
description: England fall to 196 all out as Bangladesh avoid a one-day series whitewash with a 50-run win in Chittagong.

title: Watch: Georgia lawmakers brawl over 'foreign agents' law
description: Critics say the proposed law is modelled on Russian legislation and designed to curtail freedom of speech.

title: China's new human gene-editing rules worry experts
description: Regulations were updated after an outcry over gene-edited babies but a leading expert says they don't go far enough.

title: GB News host Mark Steyn's Covid vaccine claims broke Ofcom rules
description: Mark Steyn made "potentially harmful and materially misleading" claims, the media regulator rules.

title: Manchester United: Marcus Rashford says loss to Liverpool must not 'define season'
description: Forward Marcus Rashford says he wishes Manchester United could play again immediately to "put things right" after Sunday's 7-0 loss at Liverpool.

title: Suspected poisonings of Iran schoolgirls unforgivable - Khamenei
description: Iran's supreme leaders says anyone found to have targeted schoolgirls must be punished severely.

title: Blackpool attack: Football fan dies after post-match brawl at pub
description: Blackpool FC pay tribute to "lifelong Seasider" Tony Johnson and invite fans to lay flowers at the ground.

title: Watch: Ceiling collapses, nearly hits commuter in US
description: The local transport authority in Massachusetts says it will now inspect panels in all of its stations.

title: Wayne Couzens sentenced over indecent exposures
description: The former Met Police officer is already serving a whole-life term for the murder of Sarah Everard.

title: CBI boss Tony Danker steps down after misconduct allegations
description: Tony Danker said he was "mortified" to hear that he had caused "offence or anxiety to any colleague".

title: Talks to avoid more rail strikes on brink of failure
description: Union members and rail bosses are negotiating ahead of more strikes on Thursday.

title: Six Nations 2023: Scotland's Grant Gilchrist banned for three weeks
description: Scotland second row Grant Gilchrist will miss the rest of the Six Nations after being banned for three weeks for his red card against France.

title: No Sue Gray contact during Partygate report, Keir Starmer says
description: The Labour leader refuses to say when the former civil servant was approached about joining his team.

title: Charles Bronson would not cope with release, panel told
description: Bronson, one of the UK's most violent offenders, has been in jail for much of the last 50 years.

description: Guitarist Gary Rossington had survived a 1977 air crash that killed several of his bandmates.

title: Kostyuk wins first WTA title and refuses Gracheva handshake
description: Ukrainian Marta Kostyuk wins her first WTA title at the ATX Open and refuses to shake the hand of her Russian opponent, Varvara Gracheva.

title: Russia's Wagner boss hints at 'betrayal' in Bakhmut battle
description: Russia's frontlines could collapse if Wagner does not receive ammunition, Yevgeny Prigozhin claims.

title: Notorious prisoner Charles Bronson to face parole hearing
description: The 70-year-old, who is due to face a public Parole Board hearing, was first jailed in the 1970s.

title: Bangladesh investigates huge fire at world's largest refugee camp
description: The blaze in Bangladesh has left at least 12,000 people - mainly Rohingya refugees - without shelter.

title: Djokovic withdraws from Indian Wells because of vaccination status
description: World number one Novak Djokovic withdraws from this week's Indian Wells Masters event with the Serb unable to enter the United States.

title: Mothers denied gas and air in labour say their births were traumatic
description: Women say their labours were traumatic at hospitals that have banned gas and air amid safety concerns.

title: Police searching for five missing people find three dead
description: They were last seen on a night out in Cardiff - two others are taken to hospital after a suspected road traffic collision.

title: Newspaper headlines: Migrant clampdown 'unworkable' and new 'tax clash'
description: Plans to tackle migrant Channel crossings and potential Tory tax clashes leads the papers.

title: Two-year wait or £3K for cataract op - patients opt for private
description: Long waits for surgery mean more people are using savings or loans to pay for private treatment.

title: Oscars 2023: Tackling male grief with gallows humour in An Irish Goodbye
description: The short film contender sees two brothers reunite as they try to come to terms with their mum's death.

title: Seychelles: The island paradise held prisoner by heroin
description: The BBC goes inside a Seychelles' jail to see the sharp end of a problem threatening the country.

title: Turkey earthquake: Survivors living in fear on streets
description: Train carriages, volleyball courts and public roads - families now find shelter wherever they can.

title: 'I skip university lectures to do paid work instead'
description: Heidi is one of many students who say the rising cost of living is affecting their studies.

title: Arnold Palmer Invitational: Kurt Kitayama beats Rory McIlroy by one shot for maiden PGA Tour win
description: Rory McIlroy misses out on victory by one shot at the Arnold Palmer Invitational as Kurt Kitayama keeps his composure to secure victory.

title: MOTD2 analysis: How Liverpool's 'frightening' front three ran riot against Man Utd
description: Match of the Day 2's Troy Deeney, Micah Richards and Mark Chapman discuss how Liverpool's "wonderful" front three dominated during their 7-0 win against Manchester United.

title: Dominic Raab's ex-colleagues speak out as bullying probe reaches final stages
description: Dozens of people, including the deputy prime minister himself, have now given evidence to the inquiry.
